posts.cooked: My team has sds mk2 modules, and we’re having some trouble getting them to work with falcon motors. We keep running into this issue called “can frame too stale”, and we think this means the can network is momentarily dropping resulting in positional error. I’m wondering if this is more likely a SW problem or an electrical problem. I’ve gone through all the can wiring and done the resistance test of the loop to ensure it was 60 ohms. Could this be emf noise? Or is it more likely some kind of code issue created when the software people adapted the code for the (NEO running) mk2 modules to work with falcons?

posts.name: Smtopps
posts.cooked: Did you solve this issue? we are having the same issue specifically for the Pigeon 2 and the getFusedHeading. We are going to do some CANbus cleanup since the falcon and pigeon wires have not been cut to length. Also the cancoder cables are about the same length as a falcon so we are looking at 48ft+ of can cable on a 24x24 chassis. Otherwise it drives fine but its just Robotcentric driving since the pigeon returns 0. The pigeon does work and we can get other feedback like yaw.

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
Agreed on making sure that your CAN bus wires are short and well-connected.  A couple of other things to check:

Pigeon power supply.  Presumably 12V/500mA on a VRM.  (We recently found that connecting it to a 5V circuit by mistake makes it work but with mysterious CAN bus issues.)

CAN bus utilization .  If that’s over 80% then you might be losing messages.

You could also provide some photographs of your wiring if you want more feedback.

link_counts.title: Driver Station Log File Viewer — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: We saw great improvements by implementing better wiring practices and reducing loop length. The main thing we did is ditch the molex connectors that come standard on most frc can stuff.

posts.name: Joe Witcpalek
posts.cooked:
Not sure how many items are on your CAN bus, but one thing was did was to call the SetStatusFramePeriod method on the devices slowing down messages we didn’t care about or on devices that were not being run closed loop.

On the pigeon 1, for instance, if you were calling GetYaw vs. GetFusedHeading determined which messages you cared about.  These are documented here: Common Device API — Phoenix documentation

posts.name: Smtopps
posts.cooked:
So our issue was that we worked from SDS base code which had not been setup for the pigeon2 which does not use getFusedHeading. We switched all the pigeonIMU to pigeon2 and used getYaw and setYaw. Everything works great now.

Also yes we are considering getting a CANivore . Its just expensive. Also i know some teams used the rev mini power module to power can coders. Does the pigeon get powered there too?

posts.name: tyler hedge
posts.cooked: I wonder if it could be a CAN bus utilization issue. After this occurs do you see a non-zero number of “TX Full” or “Bus Off” in your driver station’s CAN/Power tab?

posts.name: system
